item.name: /ifs available
item.description: The number of bytes available for use in the /ifs filesystem.

item.name: /ifs free
item.description: The number of bytes free in the /ifs filesystem (includes Virtual Hot Spare).

item.name: /ifs IN throughput (bps) through node {HOST.NAME}
item.description: The throughput rate (bytes per second) into /ifs thru this node.

item.name: /ifs IN throughput (bytes) through node {HOST.NAME}
item.description: The number of bytes into /ifs thru this node.

item.name: /ifs OUT throughput (bps) through node {HOST.NAME}
item.description: The throughput rate (bytes per second) out of /ifs thru this node.

item.name: /ifs OUT throughput (bytes) through node {HOST.NAME}
item.description: The number of bytes out of /ifs thru this node.

item.name: /ifs total
item.description: The total cluster capacity of the /ifs filesystem in bytes.

item.name: /ifs used
item.description: The number of bytes used in the /ifs filesystem.

item.name: Access time enabled
item.description:
Indicates if access time tracking is enabled on the /ifs filesystem.
0 = no 1 = yes

item.name: Access time grace period
item.description: The minimum amount of time (in milliseconds) between updates to a file's last access time.

item.name: Cluster node count
item.description: The total number of nodes in the cluster.

item.name: Clusterwide /ifs IN throughput (bps)
item.description: The cumulative throughput rate (bits per second) into /ifs.

item.name: Clusterwide /ifs IN throughput (bytes)
item.description: The cumulative number of bytes into /ifs.

item.name: Clusterwide /ifs OUT throughput (bps)
item.description: The cumulative throughput rate (bits per second) out of /ifs.

item.name: Clusterwide /ifs OUT throughput (bytes)
item.description: The cumulative number of bytes out of /ifs.

item.name: Clusterwide CPU (idle)
item.description: Average amount of idle CPU time (per mil) averaged for all nodes averaged for all nodes over the last 5 seconds.

item.name: Clusterwide CPU (interupt)
item.description: Average amount of CPU time (per mil) used by interrupts averaged for all nodes over the last 5 seconds.

item.name: Clusterwide CPU (nice)
item.description: Average amount of CPU time (per mil) used by nice processes averaged for all nodes over the last 5 seconds.

item.name: Clusterwide CPU (system)
item.description: Average amount of CPU time (per mil) used by system processes averaged for all nodes over the last 5 seconds.

item.name: Clusterwide CPU (user)
item.description: Average amount of CPU time (per mil) used by user processes averaged for all nodes over the last 5 seconds.

item.name: Clusterwide network IN throughput (bps)
item.description: The cumulative input rate (bits per second) for all external interfaces.

item.name: Clusterwide network IN throughput (bytes)
item.description: The cumulative input bytes for all external interfaces.

item.name: Clusterwide network OUT throughput (bps)
item.description: The cumulative output rate (bits per second) for all external interfaces.

item.name: Clusterwide network OUT throughput (bytes)
item.description: The cumulative output bytes for all external interfaces.

item.name: Offline nodes
item.description: A comma-separted list of the logical node numbers of the offline nodes in the cluster.

item.name: Online nodes
item.description: A comma-separted list of the logical node numbers of the online nodes in the cluster.

item.name: Scheduled snapshot creation enabled
item.description:
Indicates if the scheduled (automatic) creation of snapshots should occur.
0 = no 1 = yes

item.name: Scheduled snapshot deletion enabled
item.description:
Indicates if the scheduled (automatic) deletion of snapshots should occur.
0 = no 1 = yes

item.name: Snapshot reserve (%)
item.description: The percent of storage space reserved for snapshots. The value report is a percentage of total cluster storage capacity.

item.name: Snapshot root access (cifs)
item.description:
Indicates if the /ifs/.snapshot directory is accessible to CIFS clients.
0 = No 1 = Yes

item.name: Snapshot root Access (local)
item.description:
Indicates if the /ifs/.snapshot directory is visible to local users.
0 = No 1 = Yes

item.name: Snapshot root access (nfs)
item.description:
Indicates if the /ifs/.snapshot directory is accessible to NFS clients.
0 = No 1 = Yes

item.name: Snapshot root visibility (cifs)
item.description:
Indicates if the /ifs/.snapshot directory is visible to CIFS clients.
0 = No 1 = Yes

item.name: Snapshot root visibility (local)
item.description:
Indicates if .snapshot directories in subdirectories of /ifs are visible to local users.
0 = No 1 = Yes

item.name: Snapshot root visibility (nfs)
item.description:
Indicates if the /ifs/.snapshot directory is visible to NFS clients.
0 = No 1 = Yes

item.name: Snapshot subdir access (cifs)
item.description:
Indicates if .snapshot directories in subdirectories of /ifs are visible to CIFS clients.
0 = No 1 = Yes

item.name: Snapshot subdir access (local)
item.description:
Indicates if the /ifs/.snapshot directory is accessible to local users.
0 = No 1 = Yes

item.name: Snapshot subdir access (nfs)
item.description:
Indicates if .snapshot directories in subdirectories of /ifs are visible to NFS clients.
0 = No 1 = Yes

discovery_rule.name: Licenses
discovery_rule.description: A list of all licenses possible on the OneFS cluster.

item_prototype.name: License expiration date for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The UNIX epoch time that {#SNMPVALUE} expires. This value is only present for evaluation licenses as normal licenses do not expire.

item_prototype.name: License Status for {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
{#SNMPVALUE} license status.
-2 = Inactive -1 = Expired 0 = Activated 1 = Evaluation

trigger_prototype.name: License status changed for license {#SNMPVALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: The license for {#SNMPVALUE} has changed. This can happen if a new license was added, an existing license was removed, or if a temporary license expires.

item_prototype.name: Largest input size of all {#SNMPVALUE} operations (bytes)
item_prototype.description: The largest input size in bytes of all {#SNMPVALUE} operations.

item_prototype.name: Number of {#SNMPVALUE} operations
item_prototype.description: The total number of operations for {#SNMPVALUE}.

item_prototype.name: Number of {#SNMPVALUE} operations per second
item_prototype.description: The number of {#SNMPVALUE} operations per second for the last 5 second.

item_prototype.name: Smallest input size of all {#SNMPVALUE} operations (bytes)
item_prototype.description: The smallest input size in bytes of all {#SNMPVALUE} operations.

item_prototype.name: Alternate name of snapshot {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: An alternate name for the snapshot.

item_prototype.name: Creation date of snapshot {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The UNIX epoch time at which the snapshot was created.

item_prototype.name: Expiration date of snapshot {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The UNIX epoch time that the snapshot expires in seconds.

item_prototype.name: Lock state of snapshot {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description:
Indicates if the snapshot is locked.
0 = no 1 = yes

item_prototype.name: Path of snapshot {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The path covered by the snapshot.

trigger_prototype.name: Snapshot {#SNMPVALUE} is about to expire
trigger_prototype.description: The snapshot {#SNMPVALUE} will expire in 6 hours.

item_prototype.name: Alias for snapshot schedule {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The alias for snapshots created by the schedule.

item_prototype.name: Expiration of snapshots from snapshot schedule {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Description of when snapshots created by the schedule will expire.

item_prototype.name: Naming pattern for snapshot schedule {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The naming pattern for snapshots created by the schedule.

item_prototype.name: Path for snapshot schedule {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The paths that snapshots will be created from for the schedule.

item_prototype.name: Schedule for snapshot schedule {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The date, time and frequency that snapshots will be created by this schedule.

item.name: /ifs IN throughput (bps) through node {HOST.NAME}
item.description: The throughput rate (bytes per second) into /ifs thru this node.

item.name: /ifs IN throughput (bytes) through node {HOST.NAME}
item.description: The number of bytes into /ifs thru this node.

item.name: /ifs OUT throughput (bps) through node {HOST.NAME}
item.description: The throughput rate (bytes per second) out of /ifs thru this node.

item.name: /ifs OUT throughput (bytes) through node {HOST.NAME}
item.description: The number of bytes out of /ifs thru this node.

item.name: Access time enabled
item.description:
Indicates if access time tracking is enabled on the /ifs filesystem.
0 = no 1 = yes

item.name: Access time grace period
item.description: The minimum amount of time (in milliseconds) between updates to a file's last access time.

item.name: Chassis config number
item.description: The chassis configuration number.

item.name: Chassis model
item.description: The chassis model name.

item.name: Chassis number
item.description: A logical chassis number.

item.name: Chassis serial number
item.description: The chassis serial number.

item.name: Chassis unit LED status
item.description:
Indicates if the unit ID light on the chassis is lighted. This is the blue service light on the back of the chassis. A value of NA indicates that no Unit ID LED exists on the chassis.
-1 = NA 0 = No 1 = Yes

item.name: Cluster configured nodes
item.description: A comma-separted list of the logical node numbers of the configured nodes in the cluster.

item.name: Cluster GUID
item.description: The globally unique identifier for the cluster.

item.name: Cluster Name
item.description: The name of the cluster.

item.name: Cluster node count
item.description: The total number of nodes in the cluster.

item.name: Node CPU (Idle)
item.description: Average amount of CPU (per mil) used by idle processes within the last 5 seconds for all CPUs.

item.name: Node CPU (Interupt)
item.description: Average amount of CPU (per mil) used by interupts within the last 5 seconds for all CPUs.

item.name: Node CPU (nice)
item.description: Average amount of CPU (per mil) used by nice processes within the last 5 seconds for all CPUs.

item.name: Node CPU (system)
item.description: Average amount of CPU (per mil) used by system processes within the last 5 seconds for all CPUs.

item.name: Node CPU (user)
item.description: Average amount of CPU (per mil) used by user processes within the last 5 seconds for all CPUs.

item.name: Node health
item.description:
Overall health of node.
0 = OK 1 = Attention 2 = Down 3 = Invalid

item.name: Node name
item.description: Name of OneFS node.

item.name: Node network IN throughput (bps)
item.description: The total input rate (bits per second) into the node's external interfaces.

item.name: Node network IN throughput (bytes)
item.description: Total bytes into the node's external interfaces.

item.name: Node network OUT throughput (bps)
item.description: The total output rate (bits per second) from the node's external interfaces.

item.name: Node network OUT throughput (bytes)
item.description: Total bytes out of the node's external interfaces.

item.name: Node readonly status
item.description:
Reports whether the node is in a read only state.
0 = no 1 = yes

item.name: Node type
item.description:
OneFS node type.
0 = storage 1 = accelerator

item.name: Number of network interfaces
item.description: The number of network interfaces (regardless of their current state) present on this system.

discovery_rule.name: CPUs
discovery_rule.description: List of CPUs (by polling CPU User time).

item_prototype.name: CPU idle time on CPU {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Amount of CPU (per mil) used by idle processes within the last 5 seconds for the CPU.

item_prototype.name: CPU interrupt time on CPU {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Amount of CPU (per mil) used by interrupt processes within the last 5 seconds for the CPU.

item_prototype.name: CPU nice time on CPU {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Amount of CPU (per mil) used by nice processes within the last 5 seconds for the CPU.

item_prototype.name: CPU system time on CPU {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Amount of CPU (per mil) used by system processes within the last 5 seconds for the CPU.

item_prototype.name: CPU user time on CPU {#SNMPINDEX}
item_prototype.description: Amount of CPU (per mil) used by user processes within the last 5 seconds for the CPU.

item_prototype.name: Bits per second IN on disk in {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The input rate (bits per second) into this disk.

item_prototype.name: Bits per second OUT on disk in {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The output rate (bits per second) from this disk.

item_prototype.name: Chassis number for disk in {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The chassis which contains the disk.

item_prototype.name: Device name for disk in {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The device name for this disk.

item_prototype.name: Firmware version for disk in {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The firmware version installed on the disk.

item_prototype.name: Health status of disk in {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The operations status of the disk. Gone drives are considered not part of /ifs.

item_prototype.name: Logical disk number for disk in {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The disk logical identification number.

item_prototype.name: Model of disk in {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The manufacture and model name of the disk.

item_prototype.name: Operations per second on disk in {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The number of disk operations per second.

item_prototype.name: Serial number of disk in {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The serial number of the disk.

item_prototype.name: Size (bytes) of disk in {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The size of the disk in bytes.

trigger_prototype.name: Disk in {#SNMPVALUE} is not healthy on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: A disk in {#SNMPVALUE} is reporting unhealthy. A replacement drive should be ordered.

item_prototype.name: Description of fan {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The description of the fan.

item_prototype.name: Speed of fan {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The current speed of the fan in revolutions per minute (RPM).

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description:
You may also consider using IF-MIB::ifType or IF-MIB::ifAlias for discovery depending on your filtering needs.
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Admin status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The desired state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Description of interface $1
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the interface hardware/software.

item_prototype.name: Inbound errors on interface $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: Incoming traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets in valid MAC frames received on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: Operational status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Outbound errors on interface $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that could not be transmitted because of errors.

item_prototype.name: Outgoing traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets transmitted in MAC frames on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status was changed on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE}

item_prototype.name: Amp/Volt reading of power sensor {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The current reading of the sensor in volts or amps.

item_prototype.name: Description of power sensor {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The description of the sensor.

item_prototype.name: Largest input size of all {#SNMPVALUE} operations (bytes)
item_prototype.description: The largest input size in bytes of all {#SNMPVALUE} operations.

item_prototype.name: Number of {#SNMPVALUE} operations
item_prototype.description: The total number of operations for {#SNMPVALUE}.

item_prototype.name: Number of {#SNMPVALUE} operations per second
item_prototype.description: The number of {#SNMPVALUE} operations per second for the last 5 second.

item_prototype.name: Smallest input size of all {#SNMPVALUE} operations (bytes)
item_prototype.description: The smallest input size in bytes of all {#SNMPVALUE} operations.

item_prototype.name: Description of sensor {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: Description of the temperature sensor.

item_prototype.name: Temperature of sensor {#SNMPVALUE}
item_prototype.description: The current reading of the temperature sensor in degrees celsius.

trigger.name: /ifs has less than 10% free space on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: There is less than 10% free space on /ifs.

trigger.expression: ({Template SNMP OneFS Cluster:isilon.ifsFreeBytes.0.last(0)}/{Template SNMP OneFS Cluster:isilon.ifsTotalBytes.0.last(0)})<0.2&({Template SNMP OneFS Cluster:isilon.ifsFreeBytes.0.last(0)}/{Template SNMP OneFS Cluster:isilon.ifsTotalBytes.0.last(0)})>0.1
trigger.name: /ifs has less than 20% free space on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: There is less than 20% free space on /ifs.

trigger.name: Chassis LED light is lit on host {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Chassis unit LED light is lit on {HOST.NAME}.

trigger.name: Cluster node count changed on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The number of nodes in the cluster has changed. This could be due to a node joining or leaving the cluster.

trigger.name: Cluster node count changed on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The number of nodes in the cluster has changed. This could be due to a node joining or leaving the cluster.

trigger.name: Node health in ATTENTION state on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: This nodes health has degraded. Further investigation is required.

trigger.name: Node in DOWN state on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: This node is reported as being DOWN. A reboot is likely needed.

trigger.name: Node in INVALID state on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: This node is reported as being in an INVALID state.

trigger.name: Node {HOST.NAME} is in read-only mode
trigger.description: Node {HOST.NAME} is in read-only mode and will not accept write operations.

trigger.name: Scheduled snapshot creation is disabled
trigger.description: Scheduled snapshot creation is disabled. Any scheduled snapshots will be ignored and not taken.

trigger.name: Scheduled snapshot deletion is disabled
trigger.description: Scheduled snapshot deletion is disabled. Any snapshots scheduled to be deleted will not be deleted. This can cause an unexpected increase in disk consumption.
